Module com.ning.breakout
Package com.ning.breakout.model

Class BallModel

java.lang.Object
com.ning.breakout.model.BallModel
public class BallModel extends Object
Model class of the ball, which defines the attributes (radius, position of five feature points) of the ball and provides methods to access/modify these attributes.
Author:
Ning ZHU - modified

  • Constructor Summary

    BallModel(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radius)
    The class constructor specifies the radius and the position of five feature points of the ball.

  • Constructor Details

    • BallModel

      public BallModel(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radius)
      The class constructor specifies the radius and the position of five feature points of the ball.
      Parameters:
      center - the center point of the ball
      radius - the radius of the ball

  • Method Details

    • getCenterPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getCenterPoint()
      Returns:
      the center point of the ball

    • getUpPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getUpPoint()
      Returns the up point of the ball.

      Assume the coordinate of the center point is (x, y) and the radius of the ball is r, the coordinate of the up point is (x, y - r).

      Returns:
      the up point of the ball

    • getDownPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getDownPoint()
      Returns the down point of the ball.

      Assume the coordinate of the center point is (x, y) and the radius of the ball is r, the coordinate of the down point is (x, y + r).

      Returns:
      the down point of the ball

    • getLeftPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getLeftPoint()
      Returns the left point of the ball.

      Assume the coordinate of the center point is (x, y) and the radius of the ball is r, the coordinate of the left point is (x - r, y).

      Returns:
      the left point of the ball

    • getRightPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getRightPoint()
      Returns the right point of the ball.

      Assume the coordinate of the center point is (x, y) and the radius of the ball is r, the coordinate of the up point is (x + r, y).

      Returns:
      the right point of the ball

    • setCenterPoint

      public void setCenterPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D pos)
      Parameters:
      pos - the position of the center point

    • updatePoints

      public void updatePoints()
      Updates the up, down, left and right points of the ball.

      Based on the position of the center point and the radius of the ball, updates the position of up, down, left and right points of the ball. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void setPoints(double width,double height){
      up.setLocation(center.getX(),center.getY()-(height / 2));
      down.setLocation(center.getX(),center.getY()+(height / 2));

      left.setLocation(center.getX()-(width / 2),center.getY());
      right.setLocation(center.getX()+(width / 2),center.getY());
  }
